revised_response:
Solve the following questions: Tom plants 10 trees a year.  Every year he also chops down 2 trees a year.  He starts with 50 trees.  After 10 years 30% of the trees die.  How many trees does he have left?
The following reasoning has an inconsistency:
Tom plants 10 trees every year, so after 10 years he has planted 10 * 10 = 100 trees.
        He also chops down 2 trees every year, so after 10 years he has chopped down 2 * 10 = 20 trees.
        He starts with 50 trees, and after 10 years he has planted 100 trees and chopped down 20 trees, so he has 50 + 100 - 20 = 130 trees.
        However,
Wait … 30% of the trees die, so 30% of 130 trees is 0.30 * 130 = 39 trees.
        Therefore, Tom has 130 - 39 = 91 trees left.

The answer is 91.
